channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Accident waiting to happen for cyclists, 28th August
item.description:
This bin prevents vehicles leaving Elm Terrace from having a clear view of the oncoming traffic to the right without pulling out into the cycle lane. Please relocate this bin to a position that solves this dangerous issue. Also more needs to be done to stop vehicles parking on the pavement as shown.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elm Terrace, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hello. These flags have been put outside my house without my permission. They are also on lamposts along the street and paint is on the road and obscuring names of roads., 28th August
item.description:
The flags have been putup without permission. I don't know if they are safe as cars travel along the road and I don't know if they are safe.

item.title: Lift utilised by cleaning services and rubbish left in, 28th August
item.description:
The lift is regularly utilized by the cleaning team to transport rubbish from upset floor to ground. This time they forgot to take the rubbish out and left it in the lift. It has been there for few days now.Please remove rubbish and re consider cleaning procedures. The practice to use the communal lift to transport rubbish is not hygienic

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
